newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Bank of Korea steps in to slow won vs dlr.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Korea steps in to slow won vs dlr.

text.p: The central bank of Korea intervened in the interbank market in mid-morning trading on Tuesday to support the falling won against the dollar, dealers said.
But the bank denied the action, as it routinely does.
Dealers said the central bank came in when the won hit the morning low of 845.00.
"The market has been tight on dollars due to large import deals and fewer export negotiations," one trader said.
Traders said the local currency was set to slip further if not for central bank support.
